citation.abstract: In light of inverse relationships reported in observational studies of vitamin D intake and serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D levels with risk of nonmelanoma skin cancer (NMSC) and melanoma, we evaluated the effects of vitamin D combined with calcium supplementation on skin cancer in a randomized placebo-controlled trial.
citation.title: Calcium Plus Vitamin D Supplementation and the Risk of Nonmelanoma and Melanoma Skin Cancer: Post Hoc Analyses of the Women's Health Initiative Randomized Controlled Trial.

author.name: Rafael Schmerling
author.description: Este é um canal para discutirmos novidades e dificuldades nas áreas de melanoma e sarcoma. O canal foi pensado para médicos, mas pacientes são bem vindos!

author.name: Valene Dornan
author.description: I'm 34 and looking for that little bit exra in life with that special person when I find him.

facebook.title: Calcium Plus Vitamin D Supplementation and the Ris... [J Clin Oncol. 2011] - PubMed result
facebook.summary: Calcium + Vitamin D for Melanoma in Women: A just-released study (Stanford) shows that after a 7 year follow-up, women with a history of non-melanoma skin cancer reduced their risk of developing melanoma by 57% by taking 400 IU vitamin D + 1000 mg calcium

facebook.title: Calcium Plus Vitamin D Supplementation and the Risk of Nonmelanoma and Melanoma Skin Cancer: Post Ho
facebook.summary: Women who were at high risk of melanoma had a 50% risk reduction when taking calcium and vitamin D.  Another reason to take calcium and vitamin D every day!

news.title: Ask Emily: How do I separate fact from fiction on cancer treatments?
news.summary: Dear Emily, My wife has a pretty common problem: cancer. While we’re very fortunate that her brand of the condition (not-yet-metastatic melanoma) hasn’t led to any life-threatening complications just yet, we’re trying to be vigilant on any life…
